sentences.english: She licked the honey off the spoon.
Habit and behavior of salt licking of golden takins was observed from June to August, 1997.
sentences.chinese: 本文報道了秦嶺羚牛的舔鹽行爲和習性。

sentences.english: The milk you put out in the saucer was quickly lapped up by the cat.
sentences.chinese: 你倒在碟子裏的牛奶很快就被貓舔光了。

sentences.english: He sat down to lap the soup with his long pink tongue.
sentences.chinese: 他坐下來用他那粉紅色的長舌頭舔那碗湯。

sentences.english: With my tongue I can feel the silencer holes we drilled into the barrel of the gun.
sentences.chinese: 我的舌頭可以舔到槍管上我們鑿出來的一個個消音孔。

sentences.english: After dinner, it will lick hairines.
sentences.chinese: 喫完飯了，它就舔起毛來。

sentences.english: How a woman suggestively licking a lolly could face a sex harassment case.
sentences.chinese: 女性辦公室舔冰棍是性騷擾。

sentences.english: I tasted blood again, gingerly touched my split upper lip.
sentences.chinese: 輕舔開裂的上脣，我又嚐到血腥味。

sentences.english: Probing into my bad tooth with my tongue, I could feel the enlarged hole.
sentences.chinese: 我用舌頭舔我那顆蟲牙，感到牙齒上的空洞在變大。

sentences.english: His wicked trick is to get the kids to kick bricks and lick the cricket ticket.
sentences.chinese: 他的缺德惡作劇是讓孩子們踢磚和舔板球門。

sentences.english: He licked a finger and pushed at the pages of the notebook.
sentences.chinese: 他舔了舔手指，掀動他那個筆記本。

sentences.english: He licked a finger and pushed at the pages of the notebook.
sentences.chinese: 他舔了舔手指，掀動他那個筆記本。

sentences.english: Too a little bit red lips licked around ground to speak of the words that the Ci goes.
sentences.chinese: 太紅了點的嘴脣，舔來舔去地說起了辭行的話。

sentences.english: Too a little bit red lips licked around ground to speak of the words that the Ci goes.
sentences.chinese: 太紅了點的嘴脣，舔來舔去地說起了辭行的話。

sentences.english: The child finished the dessert and then licked the plate.
sentences.chinese: 孩子喫完了甜點後把盤子舔得乾乾淨淨。

sentences.english: It totters when she licks it with her tongue.
sentences.chinese: 母牛用舌頭舔舔，他便搖搖晃晃站立不了。

definition: tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
to smear/to wipe/to erase/classifier for wisps of cloud, light-beams etc
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
to hold with one's mouth (as a smoker with a cigarette or a dog with a bone)
to moisten/to be infected by/to receive benefit or advantage through a contact/to touch
